snippet: Representative Tim Scott, the first black senator from the South since the late 19th century, will become a rising Republican in a party searching for new leaders.
abstract: Rep Tim Scott of South Carolina is appointed to succeed Sen Jim DeMint, who is stepping down, in United States Senate, making him first black senator from the South since late 19th century; Scott, hopeful star in the Republican party, rose to prominence on wave of the Tea Party movement.
lead_paragraph: Representative Tim Scott, the first black senator from the South since the late 19th century, will become a rising Republican in a party searching for new leaders.

headline.seo: Rep. Tim Scott Chosen to Replace Jim DeMint as South Carolina Senator
headline.main: Congressman Is Chosen to Succeed DeMint as South Carolina Senator
headline.print_headline: Congressman Is Chosen to Succeed DeMint as South Carolina Senator
